bibl.title: Letter from John J. Moran to Philip Showalter Hench, October 18, 1940

div1.p: Moran translates and transcribes for Hench a letter Moran has received from the Cuban government regarding Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from John J. Moran to Philip Showalter Hench, October 18, 1940
div1.opener:
Havana, Oct. 18, 1940.
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
MAYO CLINIC,
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Doctor:
div1.p:
I quote the GIST of a letter received a few minutes ago from
Dr. Domingo Ramos' Secretary in the section “Instituto Tecnico de Salu-
bridad Rural”, of which Dr. Ramos is Director. You will recall the
young lady who removed the picture from the frame for us, Miss Blanca
Malaret. The letter is dated October 16th, evidently following my meet-
ing Dr. Ramos in Dr. Albertini's office, but it was just delivered to me
about ten minutes ago, by messenger:

Mr. John J. Moran,
c/o Cia. Sunoco de Cuba,
Infanta 455-57,
La Habana.

p.hi: T R A N S L A T I O N

div1.p:
In the name of our Director, Dr. Domingo F. Ramos, I take
pleasure in transmitting to you COPY of a letter written to him by Dr.
P. S. Hench, seeking various data in relation to Camp Lazear in which
he (Dr. Hench) is interested.

Dr. Ramos wishes to have you endeavor to secure the data
which Dr. Hench calls for, in view of the fact that he (Dr. R.) has
not been able to furnish all of same.

I have checked in red pencil those which Dr. Ramos has been
able to furnish, as follows: (Your question translated into Spanish)

The Military Hospital has been named “Hospital Aristides
Agramonte”.

The Bulletin entitled “Monuments to the Memory of the Heroes
and Martyrs in the struggle against yellow fever” have been sent to Dr.
Hench by mail.

There are several other questions which Major Randin, Chief
of Military Sanitation, promised to reply to, but in view of the fact
that they have delayed somewhat, I have decided to not wait further
for them and to send you the replies which I can make.

Appreciating, in the name of Dr. Ramos all the interest you
can give to this matter, I remain, with great consideration,

(Sgd) BLANCA MALORET
Secretary to the Director.

NOTE: The bracketed words are mine. I think Dr. Ramos could answer,
offhand, more of your questions, especially those dealing with the
“proposed Lazear Memorial”. After I talk with you, we will try to
get a definite answer as to when (and in what form) the “Memorial” is
expected to get under way.
